column5: Just saw this on Facebook, looks interesting!  https://www.facebook.com/hookeze/

Have a dozen of them, not worth thinking about Cliff. You can tie a Palomar knot quicker. Buddy picked up a bunch at Icast and give me them, showed them to my other buds, they had a laugh. Sometimes Old School is better Clif
What I do like is putting your hook inside it when traveling.... Nice and safe... Especially with kids around
Kids shouldn't be around fish hooks anyway...theyr'e dangerous.
At first I thought it kinda cool too... Then I thought - treble hooks?  Doesn't look like it would work with them - which we use a lot!  Michael
I wonder. How well would that work with smaller steelhead hooks?
We have a few.  I don't use them for tying knots, I use them for travel.  I like them!
Joey - what about on treble hooks like I said?  They still work?  I'm guessing at best they'd only cover 1 of the 3.  Michael
Neat gadget!  I'd at least give it a try.  Old school is good Fish Farmer but how old do you have to be!!  LOL!
That reply couldn't have been better!

Joey - what about on treble hooks like I said?  They still work?  I'm guessing at best they'd only cover 1 of the 3.  Michael  LOL, no, they're not made for treble hooks.  I use them when we go pickerel fishing.
Looks handy!  I just use a snap lock swivel however till im out on the water.
I tried one and it was all right until I dropped it the drink. Will I get another one?  Probably not it is a gadget!!!!
